intro: Habranthus tubispathus f. bicolor, commonly known as the bicolor spider lily, is a striking ornamental plant native to South America. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its tall, slender stems and clusters of bell-shaped flowers. The plant features two-toned petals, typically white with a deep purple or violet base, creating a visually appealing contrast. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers full sun to partial shade, making it a popular choice for gardens. Due to its unique appearance and relatively easy care, it is often cultivated for its ornamental value.
